name: 2016-summer-workshop
tagline: ISCB DC Area Regional Student Group - Summer 2016 Workshop
body:
### ISCB DC Area Regional Student Group - Summer 2016 Workshop #### June 15, 2016 Welcome to the homepage for the [ISCB](http://www.iscb.org/) Washington DC metropolitan area regional student group ([RSG](http://rsg.iscbsc.org/)) 2016 summer workshop! One June 15, 2016, we will be hosting a free one-day workshop series with hand-on/open laptop workshops focused on various topics in bioinformatics, computational biology and genomics. The workshop is student driven, with primarily graduate students and post-docs leading the various discussions, but open to anyone interested - students, post-docs, faculty, staff scientists, etc. There will be several workshop sessions throughout the day, and at each session, attendees can choose from one of two topics of interest to them. For a complete list of workshop topics, see the "schedule" section below. ### Schedule
Time Location Session A Session B
09:00 - 09:30 BRB 1103 Welcome and introductions
09:30 - 10:45 Loc A / Loc B Workshop 1A (speaker) Workshop 1B (speaker)
### Registration ### Location / Getting there The workshop will take place in the Biosciences Research Building (BRB) on the University of Maryland, College Park campus. We will meet in room 1103 in the in the morning, and for coffee and lunch breaks. The workshops sessions themselves will be held in separate room nearby, as posted on the schedule. **BRB 1103** **Biosciences Research Bldg, College Park, MD 20740** #### Metro There is a [free shuttle bus service](http://www.dots.umd.edu/schedules.html) that runs between the [College Park metro stop](http://www.wmata.com/rail/station_detail.cfm?station_id=79) on the green line and the University of Maryland campus: - Exit from the metro station, and follow the tunnel which leads under the train tracks in the rear. - Take the stairs up and look for signs for the **104 Shuttle** immediately to your right. - Take the bus to the Regents Parking Garage stop (the terminal stop for the bus line). - Walk up Fieldhouse Drive and to the left ([walking directions](https://goo.gl/maps/7egZ8ctXxnq).) #### Driving There are metered parking spaces throughout the campus. There nearest location is the [Regents Parking Garage](https://goo.gl/maps/4ySBbiKtm7n), which is a 2-3 minute walk from Biosciences Research Building. See the [UMD DOTS website](http://www.transportation.umd.edu/maps&apps.html) for more information on parking locations and rates. ### Contact If you have any questions about the meeting, you can contact one of the meeting organizers: [Keith Hughitt](mailto:khughitt@umd.edu) or [Thomas Peterson](mailto:tpeters1@umbc.edu). ### Acknowledgements This meeting would not have been possible without the generous support of many different individuals and organizations. We could like to thank: - The Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology ([CBCB](http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/)) for supporting this meeting in all capacities, including providing meals and coffee. - The [UMD Biology Department](http://biology.umd.edu/) (and in particular Gwen Warman) for providing us with a venue for the meeting and helping with various meeting logistics. - The speakers for the workshop, without whom the meeting would be much shorter and much less interesting! - The [ISCB](http://www.iscb.org/) for their role in creating and supporting all of the various [regional students groups](http://rsg.iscbsc.org/).
